noun.description: The attitude or practice of accepting a situation as it is and being prepared to deal with it accordingly.
examples: the summit was marked by a new mood of realism

noun.description: The quality or fact of representing a person, thing, or situation accurately or in a way that is true to life.
examples: the earthy realism of Raimu's characters

noun.description: The doctrine that universals or abstract concepts have an objective or absolute existence. The theory that universals have their own reality is sometimes called Platonic realism because it was first outlined by Plato's doctrine of “forms” or ideas.
